children.name: pharmacology
children.definition: the study of medicines and drugs, including their action, their use and their effects on the body :khoa dược lý
examples: pharmacologist[ C ] a person who has studied pharmacology nhà dược học
pharmaceutical[adj]relating to the production of drugs and medicines :dược
the pharmaceutical industry
a pharmaceutical company/product/journal

children.name: prescription
children.definition: a piece of paper on which a doctor writes what medicine a sick person should have, so that they can get it from a pharmacist : đơn thuốc
examples: Prescriptioncharges(= the standard amount of money you pay for any medicine prescribed by a doctor) are rising in June.
prescription for
a prescription for sleeping pills
I got the prescription filled on the way home.

children.name: give sb a prescription
examples: Dr. Kleinert gave me a prescription for some sleeping tablets.

children.name: write a prescription
children.definition: alsowrite out a prescription
examples: I'll write you a prescription for some skin cream.

children.name: make up a prescription
children.definition: alsofill a prescriptionUS
examples: (= give a patient the drugs that a doctor says they need )You can get the prescription made up at a chemist's.

children.name: a doctor's prescription
examples: Most of these drugs require a doctor's prescription.

children.name: a repeat prescription
children.definition: one that you have regularly
examples: I went to the surgery to pick up a repeat prescription.

children.name: medicine
children.definition: a substance used for treating illness, especially a liquid you drink :
examples: Medicines should be kept out of the reach of children.
Have you beentakingyourmedicine?
Taketwo spoonfuls of medicine at mealtimes.
a medicine bottle
medicine chest/ cabinet(= for keeping medicine in)
►Do not say that you ‘drink medicine’. Say that youtake medicine.

children.name: pharmacy
children.definition: the activity or study of medicine preparation :dược khoa khoa bào chế dược phẩm
examples: pharmacist[C] [B2] a person who is trained to prepare medicines and who works in a hospital or shop :dược sĩ

children.name: remedy
children.definition: a medicine to treat a health problem, especially a small problem such as a cold, using plants or other natural methods: thuốc
examples: I tried some herbal remedies such as drinking camomile tea, but none of them worked.

children.name: a cold/cough/flu remedy
examples: Most cold remedies have little effect.

children.name: a herbal remedy
examples: He brought with him a bottle of his own herbal remedy for hayfever.

children.name: a natural remedy
examples: She began to look into alternative methods of treatment, such as natural remedies and hypnotherapy.

children.name: a home remedy
children.definition: one that you make at home
examples: Home remedies for colds include honey and lemon.

children.name: a traditional/folk remedy
examples: Fish oil has been used as a folk remedy since the eighteenth century.

children.name: take a remedy
examples: Have you tried taking herbal remedies?

children.name: remedy for
examples: Salt water is a good home remedy for a sore throat.

children.name: drug
children.definition: a chemical substance used fortreatingillnessesor to stop peoplefeelingpain:thuốc
examples: Morphine is a very powerful drug.
a drug used in the treatment of cancer
Drugs prescribed(= ordered for people )by doctors can be extremely hazardous if used in the wrong way.
prescription druga drug that you can only get with the permission of a doctor : thuốc bán theo toa, đơn
The article says that Ware tried to commit suicide by combining prescription drugs and alcohol.
wonder drug[informal a very effective new medicine] thần dược
It has proved to be a wonder drug for sufferers of epilepsy, reducing seizures by up to 80%.
drug for
new drugs for AIDS-related conditions
drug company/maker
The New Jersey drug maker will begin marketing its new anti-balding medication in April.
The bigdrug companiesmake huge profits.

children.name: medication
children.definition: medicine or drugs given to someone who is ill :
examples: He takes medication for his diabetes.

children.name: take medication
examples: Are you taking any medication?

children.name: be on medication
children.definition: for sth
examples: (= be taking a type of medicine )He's on medication for his blood pressure.

children.name: prescribe medication
children.definition: arrange for sb to take a particular type of medicine
examples: Doctors should always explain the reasons for prescribing any medication.

children.name: give medication
children.definition: alsoadminister medicationformal
examples: Teachers are not allowed to administer medication.

children.name: use medication
examples: The leaflet tells you how to use the medication correctly.

children.name: stop a medication
children.definition: stop taking a medication
examples: I stopped the medication when I found out I was pregnant.

children.name: come off a medication
children.definition: stop taking a medication
examples: Coming off the medication made him more aggressive.

children.name: over-the-counter medication
children.definition: one that you can buy without a doctor's order
examples: There are many over-the-counter medications available for headaches.

children.name: prescribed medication
children.definition: one for which you need a doctor's order
examples: What happens if the patient does not take their prescribed medication?

children.name: regular medication
children.definition: one that someone takes often
examples: He is on regular medication to prevent fits.

children.name: an amount of medicine or medical treatment
dose
children.definition: a measured amount ofa medicine or a drug that you should take: liều dùng
examples: The label says to take one dose three times a day.

children.name: a high/large dose
examples: High doses of the drug can have bad side effects.

children.name: a low/small dose
examples: Treatment should be started with a small dose.

children.name: a daily dose
examples: The study shows that a daily dose of aspirin may reduce the risk of developing bowel cancer.

children.name: the recommended dose
children.definition: recommended by medical experts
examples: The current recommended dose is 250 mg a day.

children.name: a lethal/fatal dose
children.definition: an amount that kills you
examples: She took a lethal dose of painkillers.

children.name: a single dose
examples: The medicine is given as a single dose.

children.name: take a dose of sth
examples: He had taken his usual dose of sleeping pills.

children.name: give sb a dose
examples: A nurse came in to give me a dose of antibiotics.

children.name: exceed the dose
children.definition: take more of a medicine than is recommended
examples: You should take care not to exceed the recommended dose of paracetamol.

children.name: dose of
examples: Never exceed therecommended doseof painkillers.

children.name: course
children.definition: especially British Englishan amount of medicine or medical treatment that you have regularly for a specific period of time

children.name: course of injections/drugs/treatment etc
examples: My doctor'sputmeona courseofantibiotics.
She needed a six-month course of physiotherapy after she broke her leg.

children.name: dosage
children.definition: the amount of a medicine or drug that you should take at one time, especially regularly : liều dùng
examples: It’s important to get the dosage right.
"What's the dosage?" "One spoonful three times a day."
You mustn't exceed therecommendeddosage.
high/low dosage
dosage of
He was recommended a high dosage of morphine.
increase/reduce the dosage
Thedaily dosageis steadily reduced over several weeks.
The dosage should be reduced to 0.5 mg.

children.name: pillbox
children.definition: a small container which pills are carried in : hộp đựng thuốc

children.name: medicine decided by a doctor or not
prescription drug
children.definition: / medicine a drug which can only be bought if a doctor orders it for you : thuốc theo toa
examples: Not everyone can afford the cost of prescription drugs.
We are trying to cut the price ofprescription drugs.

children.name: over the counter
children.definition: drugs that are bought over the counter are bought in a shop without first visiting a doctor:ngoài tiệm, không theo toa
examples: You can buy most cold remedies over the counter.

children.name: non-prescription
children.definition: a non-prescription drug is one that you can buy in a shop without a written order from a doctor

children.name: by prescription
children.definition: on prescriptionUKUSa drug that you get on prescription can only be obtained with a written order from the doctor:
examples: These drugs are only availableonprescription (= with a prescription from a doctor) .

children.name: capsule
children.definition: a small tube-shaped container with medicine inside that you swallow whole :bao con nhộng

children.name: a bottle of 500 capsules of vitamin C
examples: I advised her to take four to six garlic capsules a day for the duration of the treatment.

children.name: pill
children.definition: a small piece of medicine that you swallow : viên thuốc
examples: She managed to swallow the pill with a sip of water.

children.name: take a pill
children.definition: use it by swallowing it
examples: Have you taken your pills?

children.name: swallow a pill
examples: He swallowed a handful of pills.

children.name: pop a pillinformal
children.definition: take one too easily, without thinking about it seriously
examples: Some people just pop a pill to get a good night's sleep.

children.name: a doctor prescribes pills
children.definition: tells sb to take them
examples: Her doctor just prescribed more pills and told her to take it easy.

children.name: a sleeping pill
examples: I took a sleeping pill and tried to go back to sleep.

children.name: malaria pills
children.definition: pills that prevent malaria

children.name: diet pills
children.definition: pills that are said to help you become thinner

children.name: tablet
children.definition: a small round hard piece of medicine which you swallow:
examples: a five-day course of tablets

children.name: take a tablet
children.definition: swallow it
examples: Have you taken your tablets?

children.name: be on tabletsspoken
children.definition: be taking tablets
examples: He's on tablets for his heart.

children.name: swallow a tablet
examples: He took his own life by swallowing more than 500 tablets.

children.name: a doctor prescribes tablets
children.definition: tells someone to take them
examples: Dr Preston arrived and prescribed some pain-relieving tablets.

children.name: a sleeping tablet
examples: Sleeping tablets can be addictive.

children.name: a headache/indigestion etc tablet
examples: Do you want a headache tablet?

children.name: a paracetamol/quinine/iron etc tablet
examples: She's on iron tablets for her anaemia.

children.name: a vitamin tablet
examples: Are all these vitamin tablets really necessary?

children.name: in tablet form
examples: Although this drug is available in tablet form it is often prescribed as a powder.

children.name: eye drops
children.definition: eye/ ear etc drops liquid medicine given in very small amounts : thuốc nhỏ
examples: Remember — if you 're using eye drops for your hay fever, leave your contact lenses out.

children.name: by injection
children.definition: putting a drug into someone’s body using a special needle:
examples: This steroid is sometimes givenbyinjection.

children.name: ointment
children.definition: a thick oily substance, usually containing medicine, which is put on the skin where it is sore or where there is an injury, in order to cure it : thuốc bôi
examples: eye ointment

children.name: cream
children.definition: especially UK/lotionespecially US a thick smooth substance containing that you put on your skin to treat a medical condition:
examples: an antibiotic cream
antiseptic cream

children.name: course
children.definition: of drugs/treatment/injections/ˌkɔːʳs əv ˈdrʌgz, ˈtriːtmənt, ɪnˈdʒekʃənz/  a planned process of medical treatment, consisting of a series of regular amounts of treatment, drugs etc over a fixed period: tiến trình của thuốc/ điều trị/ tiêm chít
examples: ▪ Europeans usually need to have a course of injections before travelling to India.
▪ The disease can be easily cured with a simple course of antibiotics.
